3: Not again?
Um, at our 7 o'clock...
Let's take cover first.
Roland and Lamia find a broken wall nearby that can cover both of them, and hide in its shadow against the dawn light.
Just as Roland expected, a few Corrupted show up behind their previous position.
There aren't many of them, and they look just like ordinary wandering Corrupted.
A few hours ago—just after daybreak, to be precise—Roland didn't have any idea yet, but he and Lamia decided to head out first, trying to follow the known clues.
Soon, strange wandering Corrupted began to show up on their route every once in a while.
They kept coming. Every time, they ended up in Lamia and Roland's way, even in the areas where there was nothing to infest.
Like every time in the past, the small number of Corrupted do not pose any threat. But Roland feels something isn't quite right.
He extends his hand, trying to control their leader to turn back—
—But nothing happens.
(What's going on? Is it because of this body, or...)
Just a few wandering Corrupted... Can't we just finish them off?
So?
Don't you feel strange? These annoying Corrupted just keep coming. They can always find us.
We changed our route many times, they came back every time, even in the areas impossible for Corrupted to exist.
(Eek? I thought we were just lost...)
Eek—!
Whoever is behind them, I have no idea what they want... Are they just testing us?
(Not necessarily. They should have sent stronger forces to test us. Maybe they just wanted to change our route, so they sent those Corrupted in the hope that we would avoid them.)
(Better ask Lamia to control them if they ever show up again. I can't let her know that I've lost control of the Corrupted.)
Alright, let's kill them all!
Roland still doesn't know why his opponent sent in these soulless weaklings, but he has no time to waste on them.
Roland has a plan in mind. He rushes out from the broken wall, along with a still clueless Lamia.
They wipe off the wandering Corrupted in no time.
Looking at their remains, Roland doesn't feel victorious at all.
This is happening too often, and too easy.
(...This isn't right.)
What is it?
(What do they want from these meaningless attacks?)
(Whether they want to get rid us, or make us leave, none of that is going to happen.)
Unlike humans, attrition warfare isn't going to work on Ascendants. But if the opponents can control Corrupted, they are probably no different.
They are definitely aware that such trivial attack are never going to pose any threat. If they send in all the Corrupted together, they might at least have a chance.
(Which means, they must be doing this on purpose for some reason.)
The question is... What do they want?
...Interesting.
Eek... Just what are you mumbling? Say something that I can understand.
Perhaps Roland and Lamia are staying at the same place for too long, as Roland talks, more Corrupted have appeared on the other side of the road, stumbling toward them.
Eek...
...Have they come again?
(They must be coming from the exact same spot. I walked a large circle just to confirm this.)
Roland watches the Corrupted as they march forward. He already knows what to do.
Lamia, make them stop.
Lamia wonders why Roland doesn't do it himself, but she follows his order anyway—
But the Corrupted aren't stopping. Actually, their action is not impacted at all.
...Eek?
...I knew it.
Lamia's Ascendant power cannot take control of the Corrupted. That means the opponents possess similar abilities to control them, if not stronger.
(The only possible explanation is, these things must represent some sort of 'information' that the other party is trying to show us.)
Could it be just an out-of-control automatic factory?
(How do you explain that Lamia and I, as Ascendants, both cannot control their action?)
You seem to have already found an answer.
Maybe.
Then what are you waiting for? I don't think I need to remind you of anything.
(...Perhaps all I need is this line from you.)
You always have this problem.
Well, let's just try to walk into their trap.
We won't get what we want just from any random scavenger or Babylonia guy.
The easiest way is to ask Gabriel... But I don't think we can find him.
Roland learned from The Merciful One that Alpha survived the battle... Which means, Gabriel is probably already dead.
So... We can only go to those guys behind the 'show.'
Eek... Are we really going after them?
Actually, I think we are pretty lucky. They are already looking for us before we go after them. These Corrupted can prove it.
And I'm not going to let the chance slip.
...Alright.
Lamia can only agree.
Well then, let's trace these Corrupted and find where they come from.
Remember, Fortis Fortuna Adiuvat (fortune favors the bold).
Roland and Lamia have been walking toward the Corrupted's origin amidst ruins and wasteland.
Corrupted have been appearing sporadically, and at an increased frequency as they move forward.
This makes Roland excited—at least it proves his theory that the Corrupted were dispatched from the same place.
So... What will happen next?
(Once again, there's someone walking in front, giving orders. Feels like the good old days...)
(Hopefully this gives me a higher chance to survive... Hmm...)
Roland and Lamia keep walking for a while, but Corrupted have stopped showing up.
500 meters, 1 kilometer, 2 kilometers...
The Corrupted that always appear with fixed interval are now gone.
What does it mean? Roland starts to wonder.
Now that the Corrupted are no longer showing up, they must have achieved something. Which means—
Roland's thoughts are interrupted by the engine roar in the sky. In fact, he is expecting it—
...Is that it?
Roland and Lamia follow the sound, until it goes low in a particular direction, then becomes almost inaudible.
They continue heading in that direction, and finally arrive at the destination after climbing over a couple of building ruins.
They see a transport aircraft with Babylonia signs parked between the collapsed buildings.
Eek... This is a Babylonia aircraft, right? Why is it here alone?
Since it has come here alone, it is probably not carrying supplies or equipment, but—
They see three busy-working figures at a crossing further away.
Task Force members on a mission.
What the hell are you two doing?
Breaking the silence, Vera closes the holo-projection on her terminal and turns to face her two teammates nearby.
It's a door! Why didn't you just open it?!
Oh, could it open? I didn't notice...
Set up the gear and prepare to work.
Roger.
The Constructs begin to take out the node device used for enhancing remote connection from the crates they have been carrying.
Babylonia Task Force? What are they doing here?
Are they here for 'her'...? No, it can't be.
Roland soon dispels the idea from his mind after thinking about that female.
'She' doesn't look like the type of agent that would attract Babylonia's attention.
Could it be us then...? No, I don't think so. We haven't done anything. The last time we exposed ourselves, we were with 'her'...
Rationally, Roland knows he should stay away from the Task Force as they have no conflicts of interest with him, especially when his main mission isn't going anywhere.
But the Task Force must be sent here for some reason. Maybe that is related to what he wants to know.
(There is no need for a direct engagement. Apart from 'someone,' the rest probably won't even listen to me.)
(But I should at least find out what they are up to.)
Lamia? Time for you to shine. Go eavesdrop on them, and find out what they are here for.
Eek... Me?
I can't go stealth like you.
Um... Alright.
Perhaps they've transferred Murray to the Hellhounds. They're much better than you two, after all.
Vera has quickly regained her composure, as well as her sarcasm.
What?! No, I won't allow that! You're screwing with me, aren't you?
Ha... That's an improvement. At least you understand irony now. Alright, let's stop complaining—we have the Gray Raven Commandant with us.
I don't like it.
A mission is a mission, 21. And if someone here doesn't like it, it sure as hell is me.
Fine. Understood.
Lamia continues to listen for a while, but the only useful information she gathers is that the Gray Raven Commandant is involved in this mission.
Once Lamia gets ahold of the approximate direction and distance of Cerberus' destination, she leaves them.
(...They definitely have something to do here...)
(Better let Roland know...)
(If I can get Roland to help me... to go to 'that place'...)
(Eek... Guess I'll just have to move with him now.)
—I see.
Cerberus, and the Commandant of Gray Raven.
From Roland's past experiences, there's nothing they have in common. Yet now they have come together.
The strange combo gives Roland some weird thoughts.
...Are they here for Luna?
Whatever they have discovered, this mission must be related to Luna.
He also realizes why the Corrupted are no longer showing up.
Because they have already been guided to the right track.
Interesting...
Whoever is behind all this, it's worth investigating.
This opportunity is presented to him when he almost loses his direction. It's almost too good to be true, like a blatant trap.
But Roland never fears traps. He is used to them.
He looks forward to where it will take him.
The only problem is...
The speed difference.
Both Constructs and Ascendants can walk long distance without getting tired, but they are all based on the human body.
Lamia can travel a lot faster, but Roland doesn't trust her enough.
In that case—
Half an hour later...
Eek—! This is way too heavy! I'm so tired! I need a break!
If we keep going at this speed, we can arrive two hours earlier than Babylonia. That's a win-win for both of us.
In what way is this a win-win?! Eek—! A rock!
Even with a rein on her waist, Lamia manages to jump over a rock with incredible dexterity.
But the old cart she is pulling isn't so lucky. It bounces high above the ground and lands again, along with Roland, who is sitting inside.
Watch out, Lamia! I can't find another one if this thing breaks apart!
Then don't make me pull it eeek—
Meanwhile...
Time for your regular report.
...Situation normal. Maintaining cruising surveillance.
Altitude...6,500 meters. This is the best height for this body. I missed the target, but got to fly a little longer.
But 'Loki' doesn't like wings... I can never understand.
Stop tracking irrelevant targets.
I just wanted to let 'Loki' have some fun.
Plus, she was also one of the high-value targets that Mister mentioned. She claimed she no longer had the thing, but I didn't believe her.
Okay.
Stick to the plan.
Stay focused. Your M.I.N.D. is easily affected by other things.
...Understood.
